hero.title: Daily Vehicle Management: Preserving Value and Performance
hero.description: Master essential maintenance tasks to ensure safety, efficiency and maintain your automobile's resale value (according to automotive manufacturer and safety organization guidelines).

essentials.title: The 3 Pillars of Regular Maintenance
essentials.subtitle: Preventive maintenance is structured by frequency and importance of inspections.

items.title: Weekly Checks
points: Tire Pressure: Cold check (including spare tire)
Engine Oil Level: Check with cold engine on flat surface
Lights and Signals: Turn signals, brake lights, low and high beams (Road Safety)

items.title: Monthly Maintenance
points: Fluid Levels: Coolant and Windshield Washer Fluid
Wipers: Rubber condition and wiping efficiency
Braking: Visual inspection of discs and pads (wear)

items.title: Preventive Maintenance
points: Service Book: Strictly follow manufacturer-prescribed intervals
Wear Part Replacement: Belt, spark plugs, filters, etc. (prevention of costly breakdowns)
Traceability: Document each intervention to maintain warranty

tips.title: Practical Optimization Tips
tips.subtitle: Based on ADEME, ACEA and automotive manufacturer expertise

items.title: Eco-driving and Fuel Consumption Control
items.subtitle: Consumption Reduction (ADEME)
items.content: Adopt smooth driving, without sudden acceleration or braking, and maintain a constant speed. Anticipating slowdowns is the key to eco-driving.
items.detail: Under-inflated tires increase consumption by up to 2.4% and reduce road holding (ACEA). Check pressure regularly when cold, referring to the manufacturer's label.

items.title: Engine Longevity and Lubrication
items.subtitle: Cold Start
items.content: Let the engine idle for a few moments before driving and avoid high revs until the oil has reached its optimal operating temperature (usually after 5 to 10 minutes).
items.detail: Use only the approved engine oil specified in the vehicle manual. Respecting oil change intervals is the number one factor for engine preservation.

items.title: Bodywork Protection and Resale Value
items.subtitle: Corrosion Prevention
items.content: Wash the vehicle regularly to remove salt (winter) and pollution. Apply biannual protective wax to seal the varnish against external aggressions (UV, chemicals).
items.detail: Repair paint chips or gravel impacts without excessive delay. Exposure of bare metal to moisture very quickly leads to rust formation and spread.

items.title: The AUTYVO Advantage: Traceability
items.subtitle: Total Transparency
items.content: By recording each fill-up, each wash, and each intervention, you build a complete and certified digital maintenance history.
items.detail: This detailed traceability increases buyer confidence and can justify a higher resale price (a complete history is often a major negotiation argument).
